info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS WITH REDUCED VISIBILITY IMPACTING PORTIONS OF EASTERN OHIO AND THE NORTHERN WEST VIRGINIA PANHANDLE... At 11:55 AM, radar indicated scattered to numerous snow showers moving in an east-southeast direction across much of eastern Ohio. These will continue to impact the area into early afternoon, and will also affect portions of the northern West Virginia panhandle. The main impact of these snow showers will be a quick reduction to one-quarter mile visibility in the heaviest snow showers. Brief wind gusts to 30 MPH are also possible. A coating of snow may occur on roads, but the snow will quickly melt once the heavier snow ends. Use caution if you encounter reduced visibility or slippery roads while driving. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling. Consider delaying travel until the heavier snow showers pass your location.
